Posts.Title: BONE and CAT Scan - what to except

Posts.Content: Hello All, What type of anesthesia is utilized for LDR Brachytherapy ? I have had propofol...for colonoscopy, biopsy and cystoscope ...and there was no issues. The great news is since January, my PSA was 39.6 with a very enlarged prostate and no metasis. Since starting Casodex and HDT, my PSA has dropped to 1.96 and last week's RT simulation showed that my prostate has diminished in size. The plan is 28 days of EBRT and then LDR Brachytherapy Thank you for your support. Bulldog
Posts.Title: What type of anesthesia for LDR

Posts.Content: Thank you for everyones responce. To respond to the questions: (1) Diagnosis of Prostate Ca has not been made. Between father having prostate cancer and successfully tx with radiation in early 1990s + my PSA OF 39.6 + DRE Showing generalized firmness, Ultrasound showing enlarged prostate with no masses on kidenys or bladder- Bladder had mild atrophy, my mind has been anxiety plagued. (2) Biopsy and cystoscope is set dor 01.22.18 (3) Urologist said the Casodex was for prostate shrinkage and my family history. MY NEW QUESTIONS: 1. Is the cystoscope normal testing- for prostate ca to rule out BPH??? 2. If not, then why the test-? Thank you for everyones responses and support. It is greatly appreciated-!

Posts.Title: Trestar-?

Posts.Content: Just had my 22 of 28 I.M.R.T. Today, I was informed the following: (1) I have been receiving I.M.R.T. targeted at prostate, seminal vesicles, lymph and L5 (2) The treating of L5 was new data for me. (3) The bone scan, CAT SCAN and MRI of liver and abdnomial area were all negative. My PSA WAS 39.6 and last PSA with Casodex, Trelstar shot and I.M.R.T. WAS 0.56 [4] For treatments 25 thru 28 they are now only treating everything stated above except for the lumbar. The RT said this the the cone phase of my I.M.R.T. QUESTION: [1] WHY the treatment of of the lumbar with negative scans-? I will be speaking with the RO tomorrow for my weekly check up. Your thoughts-? Thank you Bulldog
